book_title.en: Banner Legacy, The Rise of the Fengtian Local Elite at the End of the Qing
book_title.ja: Banner Legacy, The Rise of the Fengtian Local Elite at the End of the Qing

publisher.en: Center for Chinese Studies, The University of Michigan
publisher.ja: Center for Chinese Studies, The University of Michigan

description.ja: 清末の中国東北部（満洲）において、この地域の八旗旗地制度のもとにおかれていた官荘等を管理していた八旗旗人の漢族有力者が清末の改革のなかで、地主、さらに、この地域の有力者として台頭していった歴史を、档案史料等から明らかにした。彼らの一部はさらに満洲国の高官としての地位も築いっていった。
description.en: The Eight Banners are increasingly recognized as a key institution of the Qing dynasty administration. In the Qing ancestral homeland, Manchuria, the banners came to include Mongol and Han contingents. This book argues that at the end of the Qing, as this region was placed under civil administration, many Han bannermen in the newly created Fengtian Province came to local prominence, first as landlords, then, as power elite - active participants in provincial politics- through the reform of the late Qing and the early Republic.
